snippet: Fees for the service will be $4.50 for up to $50 transferred and $9.50 for amounts above that, up to $900.
abstract: Walmart will allow customers to make store-to-store money transfers within United States; cut-rate fees for service will be $4.50 for up to $50 transferred and $9.50 for amounts above that, up to $900; offer, aimed at lower-income shoppers who often rely on places like check-cashing stores, represents another effort by Walmart to carve out space in territory once belonging exclusively to traditional banks.
lead_paragraph: Fees for the service will be $4.50 for up to $50 transferred and $9.50 for amounts above that, up to $900.

headline.main: Walmart Will Enter Cash Wiring Business
headline.print_headline: Walmart Will Enter Cash Wiring Business
